enWisdom: Felicity is that which leads [one] to success
Felicitous is one who makes his obedience [and worship] sincere
The felicitous is one who considers that which is lost [to him] as insignificant

Wisdom: السَّعِيدُ مَنْ خَافَ الْعِقَابَ فَآمَنَ وَرَجَا الثَّوَابَ فَأَحْسَنَ
enWisdom: Felicitous is one who fears the punishment [of Allah] so he has faith, and hopes for divine reward so he does good deeds
The most felicitous person is the intelligent believer

Wisdom: أَسْعَدُ النَّاسِ مَنْ تَرَكَ لَذَّةً فَانِيَةً لِلَذَّةٍ بَاقِيَةٍ
enWisdom: The most felicitous of all people is one who abandons the perishing pleasures [of this world] for the lasting pleasures [of the Hereafter]

Wisdom: إِنَّ السُّعَدَاءَ بِالدُّنْيَا غَداً هُمُ الْهَارِبُونَ مِنْهَا الْيَوْمَ
enWisdom: Verily those who are pleased with this world tomorrow are the ones who run away from it today

Wisdom: إِنْ أَحْبَبْتَ أَنْ تَكُونَ أَسْعَدَ النَّاسِ بِمَا عَلِمْتَ فَاعْمَلْ
enWisdom: If you would like to be the most felicitous of people through what you have learnt, then act upon it

Wisdom: إِنَّمَا السَّعِيدُ مَنْ خَافَ الْعِقَابَ فَآمَنَ وَرَجَا الثَّوَابَ فَأَحْسَنَ وَاشْتَاقَ إِلَى الْجَنَّةِ فَأَدْلَجَ
enWisdom: Indeed only he is felicitous who fears divine punishment so he safeguards himself, and hopes for divine reward so he does good, and longs for Paradise so he wakes up [to worship] in the night
Through God-given success felicity is achieved

Wisdom: دَرَكُ السَّعَادَةِ بِمُبَادَرَةِ الْخَيْرَاتِ وَالْأَعْمَالِ الزَّاكِيَاتِ
enWisdom: Felicity is gained by hastening good deeds and pure [and virtuous] actions

Wisdom: عِنْدَ الْعَرْضِ عَلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ تَتَحَقَّقُ السَّعَادَةُ مِنَ الشَّقَاءِ
enWisdom: When the presentation [of deeds] in front of Allah, the Glorified, takes place, felicity is differentiated from wretchedness
In adhering to the truth, there is prosperity

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ سَعَادَةً أَنْ يُوثَقَ بِهِ فِي أُمُورِ الدِّينِ وَالدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: It is enough of a felicity for a person that he be deemed trustworthy in religious and worldly affairs

Wisdom: كَفَى بِالْمَرْءِ سَعَادَةً أَنْ يَعْزِفَ عَمَّا يَفْنَى وَيَتَوَلَّهَ بِمَا يَبْقَى
enWisdom: It is enough of a felicity for a person to turn away from that which perishes and become occupied with that which is everlasting

Wisdom: لَنْ تُعْرَفَ حَلَاوَةُ السَّعَادَةِ حَتَّى تُذَاقَ مَرَارَةُ النَّحْسِ
enWisdom: You will never know the sweetness of felicity until you taste the bitterness of misfortune
One whose intellect overpowers his vain desire is successful
One whose vain desire overpowers his intellect is disgraced
